awd_titl_txt: International Travel Grant to Attend Symposium on Building  Technology and Earthquake Hazard Mitigation
awd_abstract_narration: This is an international travel grant to support the                            principal investigator's participation in the                                   "International Symposium on Building Technology and                             Earthquake Hazard Mitigation", scheduled for March 25-29,                       1991 in Kunning, China.                                                                                                                                         The Symposium is jointly organized by the National Center                       for Earthquake Engineering Research (NCEER) at the State                        University of New York and the China Building Academy in                        Beijing.  It will be implemented under Annex III of the                         US-China Protocol on Cooperative Earthquake Studies, for                        which the Division of Biological and Critical Systems at                        NSF is the implementing agency on the American side.                                                                                                            The principal investigator has an outstanding track                             record of successful research in hazard mitigation, and                         is an invited symposium speaker.                                                                                                                                The activity will advance knowledge and the technological                       basis for earthquake countermeasures and will stimulate                         bilateral research in this important area.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
